articles.title: Nvidia's Blackwell chip could push the company into a new stratosphere as the AI revolution continues
articles.summary: Nvidia's Blackwell chip is poised to further propel the company's growth in the AI sector, with analysts calling it a "beast" and an "exponential leap forward." Despite potential future competition in inference workloads, Blackwell is expected to dominate the AI training market and contribute significantly to Nvidia's record sales, even as demand continues to outstrip supply for several quarters.

articles.title: Nvidia Steps Up Hiring in China to Focus on AI-Driven Cars
articles.summary: Nvidia Corp. has expanded its workforce in China significantly this year, adding hundreds of staff to bolster research capabilities, particularly in autonomous driving technologies. The company increased its total headcount in China from approximately 3,000 to 4,000, with a key focus on adding about 200 researchers in Beijing for self-driving initiatives. This move underscores Nvidia's commitment to developing AI-driven car technology within the Chinese market.

articles.title: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Leads AI Investment in 2024, Purchasing 485,000 Nvidia GPUs to Power AI Infrastructure
articles.summary: Microsoft Corporation is leading AI investment in 2024 by acquiring 485,000 Nvidia Hopper GPUs, significantly outpacing rivals. This massive investment powers Microsoft's AI infrastructure, including its Azure cloud platform and AI services, reflecting the increasing demand for specialized hardware in the AI sector. The article also highlights the resource-intensive nature of AI, requiring substantial energy and materials, and discusses the broader implications for infrastructure and climate.

articles.title: Broadcom ETFs Surge on Strong AI Demand
articles.summary: Broadcom's shares surged by 20% following strong earnings and optimistic projections for its AI business, pushing its market cap past $1 trillion. This surge significantly boosted ETFs with large Broadcom holdings, such as the Defiance Daily Target 2X Long AVGO ETF (AVGX) and the iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX). The demand for Broadcom's custom AI chips, favored by major tech companies like Alphabet, Meta, and Apple, is seen as a key driver for its continued growth.

articles.title: CoreWeave and Dell Technologies Extend Relationship to Deliver AI at Scale
articles.summary: Dell Technologies and CoreWeave are expanding their strategic relationship to deliver AI at scale, with CoreWeave being the first to ship Dell PowerEdge XE9712 server racks with NVIDIA GB200 NVL72 to support its Cloud Services Platform. This collaboration integrates Dell's infrastructure and services with NVIDIA's accelerated computing, networking, and AI software to meet the growing demand for high-performance cloud environments for generative AI developments. CoreWeave will leverage Dell's fully integrated and validated rack systems and professional services to accelerate implementation and enhance its specialized AI cloud services platform.

articles.title: Broadcom's AI Chip Leadership Puts Pressure on Nvidia and Marvell, Analysts Say
articles.summary: Broadcom's stock surged after reporting strong Q4 adjusted EPS results and raising its dividend, driven by its leadership in AI custom Application-Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs). Analysts upgraded Broadcom's price targets, highlighting its expanding AI opportunities and advanced 3nm silicon technology, which puts it ahead of competitors like Nvidia and Marvell. The company anticipates significant growth in its AI revenues, expecting to reach $30 billion by calendar 2027 based on strong demand from hyperscalers.

articles.title: 1 Spectacular Artificial Intelligence (AI) ETF to Buy With $40 During the S&P 500 Bull Market
articles.summary: The article highlights the iShares Future AI and Tech ETF (ARTY) as a promising investment for exposure to the booming AI market, especially given the S&P 500's strong performance driven by technology stocks. It details the ETF's highly concentrated portfolio, featuring top AI companies like Nvidia and Palantir, and suggests it could be a valuable addition to a balanced investment portfolio despite its short track record.

articles.title: Pelican-2 & 36 SuperDoves Arrived in Vandenberg, California For Launch
articles.summary: Planet Labs PBC announced that its new high-resolution satellite, Pelican-2, and 36 SuperDoves have arrived at Vandenberg Space Force Base for a launch in early 2025. Pelican-2 is equipped with the NVIDIA Jetson platform for edge AI and NASA CSP Satellite-to-Satellite Communications, aiming to accelerate data delivery. These satellites will expand Planet's Earth observation capabilities.

articles.title: 3 Contrarian Investments for 2025
articles.summary: This article outlines three contrarian investment ideas for 2025 based on Morningstar's outlook, suggesting opportunities beyond richly priced US stocks. It recommends looking globally, especially towards Europe and emerging markets like China, and considering smaller US companies and traditional industries as alternatives to large growth and tech. Additionally, the article advises not neglecting bonds, particularly longer-maturity bonds, given forecasts of falling interest rates.

articles.title: Silver Lake Sells $12.9 Million Dell Technologies Stake Amid 83% Stock Surge
articles.summary: Silver Lake, a major shareholder in Dell Technologies, recently sold $12.9 million worth of Dell's Class C Common Stock following an 83% stock surge over the past year. Despite the sale, Silver Lake maintains a significant indirect holding in Dell. The transaction occurred as Dell reported strong third-quarter revenue driven by AI-based server demand, with earnings and cash dividends increasing.

articles.title: Should You Invest in the Fidelity MSCI Information Technology Index ETF (FTEC)?
articles.summary: This article evaluates the Fidelity MSCI Information Technology Index ETF (FTEC) as an investment option for broad exposure to the Technology - Broad sector. It highlights FTEC's passive management, low expense ratio (0.08%), and strong year-to-date performance (up 31.10%). The piece also details its top holdings, risk profile, and compares it with alternative technology ETFs like XLK and VGT, ultimately giving FTEC a "Strong Buy" Zacks ETF Rank.

articles.title: Microchip Expands FPGA Lineup for Medical Imaging, Smart Robotics
articles.summary: Microchip Technology Inc. has introduced new PolarFire FPGA and SoC solution stacks designed for smart robotics and medical imaging applications. These solutions aim to accelerate product development and simplify processes for power and thermally constrained intelligent edge devices, offering features like AI-assisted computer vision, diverse sensor interfaces, and integrated hardware for high-speed Ethernet. The stacks leverage Microchip's power-efficient and secure FPGAs, providing customizable hardware and software for secure and functionally safe industrial automation and portable medical imaging.

articles.title: Mag 7 ETFs Look Unstoppable Heading Into 2025
articles.summary: The "Magnificent Seven" stocks have significantly driven the S&P 500 rally by leveraging the AI boom and benefiting from reduced interest rates. With their market capitalization exceeding $18 trillion and comprising 31% of the S&P 500, these companies are projected for continued growth in 2025 due to strong fundamentals and potential defensive play in market uncertainty. Investors can gain exposure through ETFs like Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF (MAGS) and others focusing on mega-cap growth and top S&P 500 companies.

articles.title: Monolithic Power Systems: Big Growth At A Reasonable Price (NASDAQ:MPWR)
articles.summary: This article advocates for a risk-neutral portfolio strategy comprising short-term U.S. Treasuries, gold, and low-risk dividend equities, suitable for wealth preservation. Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) is presented as a growth opportunity with an estimated 15% CAGR over five years, driven by its robust fabless model and strong market presence, despite potential risks from its reliance on TSMC and Nvidia. A valuation model shows a 7% margin of safety and a December 2029 EV estimate of $54.34B for MPWR, positioning it as a viable addition to growth-oriented portfolios.

articles.title: Dow Inc. CEO buys $1.06M in common stock
articles.summary: Dow Inc. CEO James Fitterling purchased 25,600 shares of common stock for $1.06 million on December 12th. Following the transaction, Dow Inc. shares increased by 1% in after-hours trading to $40.54. The article also mentions recent price target adjustments for Dow Inc. by several analyst firms.

articles.title: Rigetti Computing Surges 692% in a Month: Is There More Room to Jump?
articles.summary: Rigetti Computing (RGTI) shares have surged by 691.9% in the past month, outperforming peers due to expanding clientele and advancements in quantum computing, including key partnerships and technological developments like the Novera QPU and Ankaa-2 system. Despite this growth, the company faces challenges such as declining revenues and gross margins due to macroeconomic uncertainties and intense competition, leading to a "Hold" rating from Zacks.

articles.title: Why is Palo Alto Networks stock price so ‘low’ today? Don’t worry. It just split
articles.summary: Palo Alto Networks (Nasdaq: PANW) completed a 2-for-1 stock split, causing its share price to appear to drop significantly. The article explains that this is an artificial adjustment and the company's overall market capitalization remains stable. Stock splits are often done to make shares more accessible to a wider range of investors without affecting the company's fundamental value.

articles.title: Is Microchip Technology (NASDAQ:MCHP) Using Too Much Debt?
articles.summary: This article analyzes Microchip Technology's debt situation, noting its net debt of US$6.14b as of September 2024. While the company has substantial liabilities, its market capitalization of US$30.1b suggests it could manage potential issues. The analysis concludes that while debt makes MCHP somewhat risky, its ability to convert EBIT to free cash flow is a positive factor.

articles.title: Palantir’s high valuation paints a stark picture of the S&P 500’s priciest picks
articles.summary: This article examines the high valuation of Palantir and other expensive stocks in the S&P 500. It suggests that a closer look at these companies' expected financial performance can reveal significant differences. Understanding these differences can help investors make informed decisions and potentially avoid losses.

articles.title: A decade ago, she took over a struggling chipmaker—now she's worth $1 billion: 'Everything takes time'
articles.summary: Lisa Su took over Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) a decade ago when the company was struggling, with its stock at $3 per share and significant staff cuts. Under her leadership, AMD's market cap has grown to over $205 billion and her net worth has reached $1.3 billion. Su, named Time's CEO of the Year for 2024, attributes her success to a long-term strategy focused on high-quality products, customer trust, and simplified operations, emphasizing that "everything takes time."

articles.title: Apple approaches $4 trillion valuation as investors bet on AI momentum
articles.summary: Apple is nearing a $4 trillion market valuation, driven by investor enthusiasm for its AI enhancements, which are expected to boost iPhone sales. The company has outpaced Nvidia and Microsoft in this race, with a roughly 16% share jump since November adding about $500 billion to its market cap. Analysts anticipate a rebound in iPhone revenue in 2025 as Apple integrates generative AI technology across its devices.

articles.title: ETW: Maintain Your Equity Exposure And Earn An Attractive Yield
articles.summary: The Eaton Vance Tax-Managed Global Buy-Write Opportunities Fund (ETW) offers a high 9.27% yield, providing income-focused investors with equity exposure and inflation protection. Despite underperforming major indices in share price, its total return, including distributions, is competitive. Currently trading at a 9.85% discount to NAV, ETW is presented as an attractive buy given its historical and peer valuations.

articles.title: Broadcom CEO Hock Tan claims he has no interest in buying Intel
articles.summary: Broadcom CEO Hock Tan has stated he is not interested in acquiring Intel Corp., focusing instead on making Broadcom an AI powerhouse. Tan cited his company's efforts to increase market share in the AI chip sector and his reluctance to pursue hostile takeovers after a past failed attempt with Qualcomm. This news comes as Broadcom's market capitalization has soared due to AI enthusiasm, while Intel's value has significantly declined.

articles.title: Rocklinc Partners Fund Established a Significant Stake in Burford Capital Ltd. (BUR)
articles.summary: Rocklinc Investment Partners, in its Q3 2024 investor letter, highlighted its stake in Burford Capital Limited (BUR), a legal finance products and services provider. The fund's Canadian companies outperformed their index, while U.S.-based companies underperformed the S&P 500. Despite acknowledging Burford Capital's potential, Rocklinc Investment Partners believes AI stocks offer greater and faster returns.

articles.title: Micron Set for Biggest Drop Since 2020 on Sluggish Sales Outlook
articles.summary: Micron Technology Inc. experienced its largest stock drop in over four years after its revenue forecast for the fiscal second quarter missed analyst projections significantly. The company attributes this downturn to sluggish demand in the smartphone and personal computer markets, despite growth in AI. Micron's sales are estimated at $7.9 billion, well below the $8.99 billion analyst estimate, with profit also falling short of expectations.

articles.title: Thought ESG was hard to define? Try its antithesis
articles.summary: This article discusses the complexities of defining and investing in "anti-ESG" portfolios, contrasting them with the already challenging ESG investment landscape. It highlights various approaches taken by anti-ESG ETFs and asset managers, such as screening companies based on executive opinions, political donations, or actively voting against stakeholder-focused proposals. The article also touches on the practical difficulties, including the limited number of Wall Street providers and the paradoxical inclusion of companies like Tesla in some anti-ESG portfolios.

articles.title: China opens probe into Nvidia, accusing company of violating its anti-monopoly law
articles.summary: China has opened an anti-monopoly probe into U.S. chipmaker Nvidia, accusing it of violating its anti-monopoly law, potentially escalating trade tensions between the two nations. This move follows the Biden administration's new limits on Chinese firms' ability to use U.S.-made chips. The investigation is related to Nvidia's 2019 acquisition of Mellanox, which China had conditionally approved in 2020.
